alert.note: Alert for Lower Jefferson; St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Jefferson; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 09 at 12:36AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF ST. JOHN THE BAPTIST, SOUTHEASTERN ST. JAMES, ST. CHARLES, WEST CENTRAL ORLEANS, NORTH CENTRAL TERREBONNE, NORTHWESTERN LAFOURCHE AND NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON PARISHES THROUGH 130 AM CST... At 1235 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles north of Reserve to near Schriever. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts 40 to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Thibodaux, Reserve, Avondale, Metairie, Hahnville, Laplace, Jefferson, Harahan, Westwego, Gramercy, Lutcher, Lockport, Mathews, Schriever, Montz, Luling, Garyville, River Ridge, and Boutte. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 198 and 234. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 6. Interstate 310 between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CST for southeastern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Lower Jefferson; St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Jefferson; Western Orleans
